intro: Spiraea praecox, commonly known as the early meadow spirea, is a deciduous shrub native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and features arching branches covered in small, white or pinkish flowers in early spring. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy and turn yellow in autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Spiraea praecox is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
